question.body: To pick up a glass of water to drink you must move your arm up. What muscle is acting as a antagonist to this action?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The biceps brachii is the agonist of this action.
Correct. The triceps brachii is located on your arm opposite of your bicep.
Incorrect. The quadricep femoris is located in your leg.
Incorrect. Your hamstring is located in your leg.

part.hint: An antagonist muscle works opposite of the action you are trying to do.

question.body: What is the agonist of the knee extension motion of kicking a football?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The biceps brachii are located in your arm.
Incorrect. The tricep brachii are in your arm.
Correct. The quadricips are located in your leg and do this motion.
Incorrect. The hamstrings are the antagonist of this action.

part.hint: An agonist is the primary mover.
